intro: Noronhia clarinerva, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is native to Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Noronhia clarinerva is also known for its ability to grow in a variety of soil types, making it adaptable to different environments.
